subject: Re: [junit] Popper 0.1, a Theory-based extension to JUnit, released
msgSnippet: It looks like the url is actually http://popper.tigris.org/ Bob http://www.junitfactory.com/ Send Java, Get JUnit Tests. Free ... Bob Evans
messageBody:
It looks like the url is actually http://popper.tigris.org/

Bob

http://www.junitfactory.com/
Send Java, Get JUnit Tests. Free


On Feb 13, 2007, at 9:59 AM, David Saff wrote:

> All,
>
> I'm happy to announce that Popper 0.1 has been released. Popper
> enables developers to specify and validate general statements about
> program behavior, called Theories. For downloads, a tutorial, and a
> link to our paper about how Theories can augment test-driven
> development, please see
>
> http://tigris.popper.org
>
> Please give feedback on the list, personally to me, or in the issue
> tracker. Thanks,
>
> David Saff
>
>



Bob Evans

http://www.junitfactory.com/
Send Java code, get tests. Free.
